name: paper-fab
description: Material Design: Button `paper-fab` is a floating action button. It contains an image placed in the center and comes in two sizes: regular size and a smaller size by applying the attribute `mini`. When the user touches the button, a ripple effect emanates from the center of the button. You may import `core-icons` to use with this element, or provide an URL to a custom icon. See `core-iconset` for more information about how to use a custom icon set. Example: Styling ------- Style the button with CSS as you would a normal DOM element. If you are using the icons provided by `core-icons`, the icon will inherit the foreground color of the button. /* make a blue "cloud" button */ By default, the ripple is the same color as the foreground at 25% opacity. You may customize the color using this selector: /* make #my-button use a blue ripple instead of foreground color */ #my-button::shadow #ripple { color: blue; } The opacity of the ripple is not customizable via CSS. Accessibility ------------- The button is accessible by default if you use the `icon` property. By default, the `aria-label` attribute will be set to the `icon` property. If you use a custom icon, you should ensure that the `aria-label` attribute is set.

src.name: src
src.description:
The URL of an image for the icon. If the src property is specified,
the icon property should not be.

icon.name: icon
icon.description:
Specifies the icon name or index in the set of icons available in
the icon's icon set. If the icon property is specified,
the src property should not be.

mini.name: mini
mini.description: Set this to true to style this is a "mini" FAB.
